Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 05/16/2024, youth was self-harming with an unknown object.
Youth has been able to give himself a friction burn on his left
forearm. Youth was also able to run past staff and climb to the top
of the building with the intention to jump off the building. Following
these incidents, he was brought to McClaren Hospital for
treatment. On the same day, while getting in the residential
vehicle to transport to another facility, youth was able to access
gasoline with the purpose to ingest it. He was unable to ingest the
gasoline and the staff intervened. There are concerns that youth is
not being supervised appropriately by staff and is still able to harm
himself.
Investigation Phone messages were left with and from Complainant on May
20, 2024, and May 21, 2024, indicating they had no additional
information.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 22,
2024. Director described Youth A being on a 1:1 staffing with
Staff 1 and running out of the unit, through a path and to the
building nearby where Youth A climbed onto the roof. Director
stated Staff 1 ran after Youth A along with other staff, himself
included. Director reported police were called and came to assist.
Director stated Youth A was transported to Caro Emergency
Room(Caro ER) by ambulance to be evaluated. Director
described Youth A was not deemed appropriate for inpatient so
was discharged. Director stated Youth A was picked up from the
hospital and transported back to the facility in the van that had
lighter fluid. Director described the lighter fluid was in the back of
2

the van from staff taking youth off campus for a barbecue a day or
two earlier and not locking it up after the outing. Director reported
staff were unaware the lighter fluid was in the van until Youth A
crawled over the seats into the back of the van and attempted to
grab the bottle. Director stated the lighter fluid is supposed to be
locked up and should not have been in the van.
Case Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
May 22, 2024. Case Manager described sitting at Caro ER with
Youth A and Staff 1 after Youth A had climbed onto the roof.
Case Manager stated Youth A told them he knew he was faster
and could outrun Staff 1 and get to the building to climb onto the
roof. Case Manager reported Youth A told the doctors at the ER
he had pre-planned to get to the roof top when he was with a staff
he could outrun. Case Manager described Youth A being
evaluated at the ER and not meeting criteria for inpatient so was
discharged to return to the facility. Case Manager stated Staff 2
arrived at the hospital in the agency van to transport Youth A back
to the facility while she followed in her personal vehicle. Case
Manager reported once back at the facility Youth A began
pounding on the van windows from the inside and crawled over
the seats into the back. Case Manager reported Staff 1 was
inside the van with Youth A while Staff 2 was standing outside at
the back of the van by the back doors. Case Manager stated
Supervisor came to assist and got into the van to help de-escalate
Youth A. Case Manager described hearing Supervisor tell Youth
A to stop pounding on the windows because they may break and
try to redirect Youth A to move out of the back of the van. Case
Manager stated she could see Supervisor sitting in the middle
seat of the van, Youth A digging through items in the back of the
van, rubbing his arm back and forth over a plastic container and
Staff 1 in the last seat leaning over with his arms stretched out
over the back seat trying to move and block Youth A’s arms.
Case Manager denied seeing the lighter fluid but could see a
plastic container. Case Manager described Youth A as sliding his
arm back and forth on the plastic container while Staff 1 was
moving his hands to block Youth A from sliding his arm back and
forth. Case Manager reported the police arrived, opened the
back of the van door and Youth A got out of the van. Case
Manager stated Youth A got out of the van with his arms behind
his back and the police officer applied handcuffs. Case Manager
reported Youth A kept twisting his wrists in the handcuffs. Case
Manager reported lighter fluid should never be stored in the van.
Case Manager stated lighter fluid is stored in a locked closet.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 22,
2024. Staff 1 reported he was Youth A assigned 1:1 staff on May
16, 2024. Staff 1 described the day going pretty well until Youth A
became escalated because Youth A was told he could not have a
beanie hat and sunglasses he found. Staff 1 stated Youth A ran
out of the building, toward the parking lot, through the marsh,
toward the building and up the antenna onto the roof. Staff 1
reported he ran after Youth A, had sight of Youth A the entire time
and radioed Supervisor. Staff 1 reported Supervisor arrived at the
building as well as the police. Staff 1 reported the police were
able to get Youth A down off the roof and Youth A was transported
to Caro ER by ambulance. Staff 1 stated he road in the
ambulance with Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A did not say
anything while in the ambulance but once at the ER started joking
with the doctors and Case Manager saying he preplanned running
from Staff 1 and getting on the roof. Staff 1 stated Youth A was
evaluated at Caro ER and was discharged back to the facility.
Staff 1 described Staff 2 arriving in the agency van and
transporting Youth A and Staff 1 back to the facility. Staff 1 stated
once they got back to the facility the plan was to take Youth A to
Ann Arbor to be evaluated because the facility was still concerned
about Youth A’s behaviors. Staff 1 described Staff 2 pulling the
van up to the front doors while Staff 1 jumped out to retrieve Youth
A’s face sheet and other documentation to take to Ann Arbor.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2 stayed in the van with Youth A. Staff 1
stated when he came back out to the van Supervisor was standing
outside the driver’s door talking with Staff 2 who was in the
driver’s seat and Youth A moved seats and sat behind Staff 2.
Staff 1 described getting into the passenger seat of the van and
Supervisor getting in the van and sitting next to Youth A. Staff 1
reported Youth A started acting out, jumped over the seat into the
back of the van and started grabbing objects that were in the back
of the van. Staff 1 stated Supervisor told Youth A to “stop”
multiple times and handed Staff 1 a box that Staff 1 put down in
the front of the van. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 got out and went to the
back of the van and stood outside the van doors. Staff 1 stated
Youth A was elbowing the glass trying to break the windows,
hitting his head on the windows and rubbing his arm back and
forth on a plastic container. Staff 1 described moving to the back
of the van because he is shorter than Supervisor and reaching
over the back seat with his arms trying to stop Youth A. Staff 1
stated he could not get the plastic container, so he just kept
moving his hands to try and stop Youth A from rubbing his arm
back and forth over the container. Staff 1 reported the police
opened the van door and placed Youth A in handcuffs. Staff 1
stated he was verbally redirecting Youth A the entire time and
4

trying to get the plastic container so Youth A could not rub his arm
back and forth, but it was lodge in the corner in the back of the
van. Staff 1 denied seeing the lighter fluid but later learned it was
in the box Supervisor handed him. Staff 1 reported lighter fluid is
supposed to be locked up and out of reach of the youth. Staff 1
was unsure why the lighter fluid was in the van.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
22, 2024. Supervisor reported receiving a call from Staff 1 saying
he was running through the woods chasing after Youth A who had
run from the building. Supervisor stated Staff 1 reported Youth A
was headed to a building and climbing up on the roof. Supervisor
reported she got to the building to see Youth A on the roof so she
called the police. Supervisor stated Staff 1 was Youth A’s 1:1 staff
and Youth A just ran away from Staff 1 out the building and Staff 1
could not stop Youth A. Supervisor described the police being
able to get Youth A off the roof and Youth A being transported to
Caro ER for an evaluation. Supervisor stated Staff 1 rode in the
ambulance with Youth A to the ER. Supervisor reported Youth A
was discharged from Caro ER and returned to the facility.
Supervisor stated once back at the facility staff were going to grab
paperwork and Youth A was going to be transported to Ann Arbor
to be evaluated because there were still concerns with Youth A’s
mental health. Supervisor described talking with Staff 2 who was
in the driver’s seat of the van and Youth A messing with the
windows from inside the van. Supervisor stated she got into the
van to talk with Youth A and Youth A climbed over the back seat
to the back of the van. Supervisor described Youth A’s behavior
as getting more erratic, banging on the windows, and grabbing
items so Supervisor called the police. Supervisor stated at one
point Youth A grabbed a bottle of lighter fluid and she took the
bottle out of his hand. Supervisor described Youth A rubbing his
arm back and forth over something in the back of the van and
Staff 1 trying to get Youth A to stop. Supervisor stated the police
arrived, opened the back of the van, and removed Youth A from
the van. Supervisor reported the lighter fluid was left in the van
from a barbecue that occurred earlier in the week. Supervisor
stated lighter fluid is locked in the staff office and should not have
been left in the van.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
22, 2024. Staff 2 reported he drove the van to Caro ER to pick up
Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 2 stated it was determined after he left
to get Youth A that Youth A would be transported to Ann Arbor to
be evaluated so Staff 2 would have to return to the facility to
retrieve paperwork on Youth A. Staff 2 reported when they arrived
5

at the facility Staff 1 ran inside to get the paperwork while Staff 2
remained in the van with Youth A. Staff 2 described Supervisor
coming outside to the van and Youth A “flipping out.” Staff 2
reported Youth A crawled over the seat to the back of the van, so
Staff 2 got out and stood at the back of the van by the doors. Staff
2 denied ever seeing the lighter fluid or Youth A rub his arm back
and forth on anything. Staff 2 stated the police arrived, opened
the van doors, and removed Youth A. Staff 2 stated it was not
until later he learned the van had lighter fluid in the back. Staff 2
reported lighter fluid should not be stored in the van and is locked
in the office.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on June 6, 2024.
Youth A stated he ran out of the building away from Staff 1,
through the woods and climbed on the roof of a building. Youth A
reported Staff 1 kept yelling for Youth A to stop but he did not
listen to Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 followed him but could
not catch Youth A. Youth A stated a female arrived at the building
as well as the police. Youth A described “self-harming” while in
the van by scratching himself and trying to drink lighter fluid.
Youth A stated the lighter fluid was in the back of the van. Youth
A described grabbing the lighter fluid and a female staff taking the
bottle from Youth A. Youth A reported there was a male staff in
the van as well trying to get Youth A to stop scratching his own
skin with his nails and rubbing his own arm to self-harm. Youth A
stated he could not recall the names of the male and female staff
in the van with him. Youth A reported both staff were telling him to
stop and Staff 1 was trying to move Youth A’s hand from
scratching his own arm. Youth A reported the police were called
and removed him from the van. Youth A stated the staff did what
they could do to stop him from self-harming but he just “wanted
to.” Youth A reported he does a lot of things to self-harm and staff
always try and stop him. Youth A is no longer at the facility but
stated it was “okay” when he was there and “staff did their job.”
Video Reviewed:
Video footage is not available as both incidents took place outside
of camera view.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s safety plan dated 5/8/24 and re-evaluated 6/6/24
indicates Youth A is on one-to-one staffing until treatment
team determines otherwise and staff are to remain at arm’s
length.
• Behavior and Activity Log for Youth A dated 5/16/2024.
Log entries hourly listing Youth A’s speed and activity.
6

Entry at 3:21pm: “Failed redirection over uniform, incident
resulting in ER transport.” Entry at 9pm: “Attempt at self
harm in front of SST, 911 called transport to Ann Arbor.”
• Caro Emergency Department report for Youth A dated
5/16/24. Report states,” Based on our evaluation, we do
not believe that the patient has true suicidal ideation or
intent, and these multiple episodes most likely appear to
represent behavioral outbursts.”
• Salesforce Incident Report for Youth A dated 5/16/2024.
Report is consistent with Staff 1, Staff 2, Case Manager,
Supervisor and Youth A’s interviews.
• Residential Critical Incident Report for Youth A dated
5/16/2024. Report is consistent with Staff 1, Staff 2, Case
Manager, Supervisor and Youth A’s interviews.
• Emailed statement from Case Manager detailing what
Youth A said at Caro ER regarding pre-planning to run
away from Staff 1 because Youth A knew he was faster
than Staff 1. The statement is consistent with Case
Manager’s interview.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report for Youth A dated 5/17/24. Report is
consistent with Staff 1, Staff 2, Case Manager, Supervisor
and Youth A’s interviews other than the lighter fluid is
referred to as gasoline.
• Tools, Equipment and Supplies Policy. Policy indicates
staff will ensure all chemical and cleaning solutions will be
accounted for following completion of cleanup activities and
locked in storage in the coordinator office or site-specific
approved storage location with locking mechanism.
• Protocols for staff supervising clients policy. Policy outlines
any additional measures to supervision of a client will be
noted in their individual safety plan or through emergency
protocols, depending on the presenting behaviors and/or
mental health of the youth.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as lighter fluid was left in
the back of the van and not stored appropriately allowing Youth A
to gain access to the lighter fluid.
The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, Youth A’s safety plan of having 1:1 staffing was being
followed and maintained. Interviews with staff and Youth A
indicate Youth A pre-planned to run away from Staff 1 because he
knew he was faster and could outrun Staff 1.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C0000295 date 6/5/23, CAP approval date 8/4/23
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
